story: Kim invited all her friends over for a slumber party. The girls ate pizza and watched movies all night. The girls stayed up talking and gossiping. Every single one of the girls didn't go to sleep all night. In contrast, none of the girls were very awake when their parents picked them up.

The two most discussable issues in the text are 'Logical Inconsistency' and 'Repetition'.

'Logical Inconsistency': The text states that "Every single one of the girls didn't go to sleep all night" and then later says "none of the girls were very awake when their parents picked them up". This is a logical inconsistency because if the girls didn't sleep all night, they should be tired, but the phrase "not very awake" implies they were somewhat rested, which contradicts the previous statement.

2. 'Repetition': The phrase "The girls" is used repetitively at the start of sentences. This could be varied to improve the flow of the text. 

Based on these two issues, I would deduct two points from the text.

prompt: A man named Fred constantly worried about having a disease and had weekly tests done. He tested positive for a disease and had surgery, but it was a false positive and his health worsened.

But because it was a false positive, Fred's health all of a sudden became healthier.

The two most discussable issues in the text are 'Repetition' and 'Logical Inconsistency'.

This repetition does not add any new information or value to the story, hence it is an issue. This results in a deduction of one point.

2. Logical Inconsistency: The text states, "But because it was a false positive, Fred's health all of a sudden became healthier." This statement is logically inconsistent. A false positive test result does not improve a person's health; it simply means that the person was mistakenly diagnosed with a disease they do not have. Therefore, Fred's health status would remain the same, not become healthier. This logical inconsistency results in a deduction of one point. 

So, based on these two issues, the text would receive a score of -2.

2. Inappropriate Lexical Choice: The phrase "Fred's health all of a sudden became healthier" is awkwardly worded. A more appropriate choice might be "Fred's health all of a sudden improved" or "Fred suddenly felt healthier". This inappropriate lexical choice should result in a deduction of one point.

So, in addition to the two points deducted by Mike, I would deduct two more points for these issues, resulting in a total score of -4 for the text.
